meanings.definition: Relating to or involving a provirus.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the proviral DNA to understand how it interacts with the host cell.
meanings.sent2: The proviral genes remained dormant within the host cell until triggered by certain conditions.
meanings.sent3: The proviral DNA threw a party inside the cell nucleus, inviting all its gene friends.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music was proviral, spreading through the school like a catchy tune.
meanings.sent5: The proviral nature of the virus made it difficult to detect and eliminate.

meanings.sent1: The proviral elements in the genome hinted at a past viral infection.
meanings.sent2: The proviral sequence integrated itself seamlessly into the host DNA.
meanings.sent3: The proviral traits in his personality made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was proviral, infecting everyone around her with joy.
meanings.sent5: The proviral behavior of the software allowed it to adapt to different operating systems.
